critique: This document primarily deals with setting the pay scales for various government employees, including those in the statutory pay systems, senior executive service, executive, legislative, and judicial branches, uniformed services, and administrative law judges. It also addresses locality-based comparability payments. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It does involve government in economic matters by setting pay, but this is a standard function. It does not seem to expand executive power beyond the routine administration. There is no obvious ideological tilt.
